data.question: What is the chemical formula for CAU-1?
What type of structure does MIL-96 have?
data.answer: MIL-96 is built up from isolated trinuclear {Al3(m3-O)(O2CR)6} clusters and corrugated chains of corner-sharing aluminum octahedra.

data.question: What is the maximum thermal stability temperature for Al-MIL-53?
What is the Langmuir surface area of CAU-1?
What is the role of aminoterephthalate in the structure of CAU-1?
data.answer: Aminoterephthalate linkers connect the octameric {Al8(OH)4(OCH3)8}12+ units to form a 12-connected net.

data.question: What is the significance of the 12-connected net in CAU-1?
data.answer: It is notable for being very rare and contributes to the formation of a three-dimensional microporous framework.

data.question: What happens to CAU-1 at temperatures above 360 °C?
Why is CAU-1 considered thermally stable?
data.answer: Because it does not show any change in crystallinity or phase transitions up to 360 °C.

data.question: How does the solvent influence the product formation in the synthesis of MOFs?
data.answer: The choice of solvent has a profound influence on product formation, affecting the complexity of the system and the types of MOFs formed.

data.question: What is the effect of using methanol as a solvent in the synthesis of CAU-1?
data.answer: Using methanol yields the title compound CAU-1 and an unidentified phase.

data.question: What is the purpose of high-throughput methods in the synthesis of MOFs?
data.answer: High-throughput methods are used for the systematic and efficient investigation of hydrothermal reaction systems to determine the optimal conditions for MOF synthesis.

data.question: What is the role of aluminum salts in the product formation of MOFs?
data.answer: Different aluminum salts influence the formation of various MOF phases, including the formation of new phases or known phases like Al-MIL-53-NH2.

Does the structure of CAU-1 change upon dehydration?
Is the octameric {Al8(OH)4(OCH3)8}12+ unit in CAU-1 unique to aluminum chemistry?
Can CAU-1 be used as a catalyst in Knoevenagel condensation?
Is the synthesis of CAU-1 influenced by the molar ratios of starting compounds?
Does CAU-1 exhibit type 2 sorption isotherm behavior?
Is the presence of aminoterephthalate unnecessary for the formation of CAU-1?
Are MIL-96 and MIL-53 based on the same inorganic building units?
